definition: A long, thin sensory feeler on the head of an insect or crustacean; also, a rod or wire that sends or receives signals.
examples: The moth brushed its antennae together.
A tall antenna stood on the roof.

extra.memory_tip: Antenna = insect’s feeler or signal stick.

definition: To stay steady without falling; an even, steady state.
examples: Try to balance on one foot. (verb)
The gymnast kept perfect balance. (noun)
A huge boulder blocked the path.
Climbers practised on the boulder.

extra.memory_tip: Boulder = rock too big to lift.

definition: A high, steep face of rock or earth.
examples: Seagulls nested on the cliff.
They looked over the edge of the cliff.

definition: A place where two parts of the body, or two pieces, meet and move; shared by two or more.
examples: Your knee is a joint. (noun)
They opened a joint account. (adjective)

extra.memory_tip: Joint = body hinge or shared thing.

definition: A piece of equipment with moving parts that does work when given power.
examples: The washing machine spins clothes dry.
A vending machine sells snacks.

definition: A machine that makes something move; relating to movement or engines.
examples: The motor in the car needs oil. (noun)
Fine motor skills help you write neatly. (adjective)

definition: Body tissue that can contract to produce movement.
examples: Exercise strengthens muscle.
He flexed his arm muscles.

definition: A large body in space that moves around a star, such as the Earth.
examples: Mars is called the red planet.
Our planet is mostly covered by water.

extra.memory_tip: Planet = huge space ball orbiting a star.

definition: A surface that rises or falls at an angle; to tilt or incline.
examples: Skiers went down the snowy slope. (noun)
The path slopes gently upwards. (verb)
